help.name: mri_mask - applies a mask volume (typically skull stripped)
help.description: This program applies a mask volume (typically skull stripped).

optional-flagged.explanation: apply M3Z/LTA to transform mask to space of input volume (can be identity.nofile, will be inverted if needed)
source volume for -xform (if not available from the xform file)
target volume for -xform (if not available from the xform file)
threshold mask volume at threshold (i.e., all values <= T considered as zero)
assume mask is a samseg segmentation and mask all non-brain labels
Crop volume around the mask. The bounding box is expanded by npad voxels in each direction. npad should be at least 1 to avoid clipping (same as -bb)
Crop volume around the mask centroid so that the final volume is of size (cFoV,rFov,sFov) voxels
Create and extract data from a bounding box around the mask. The bounding box is expanded by npad[X] voxels in each direction. npad should be at least 1 to avoid clipping
optional-flagged.argument: -bbmm npad1a npad1b npad2a npad2b npad3a npad3b
optional-flagged.explanation: Create and extract data from a bounding box around the mask. The bounding box is expanded by npad[X] voxels in each direction. npad should be at least 1 to avoid clipping
Create bounding box around mask such that ncols=nrows and nslices is odd (good for STIR)
take abs() before applying threshold
Invert mask (or turn off inversion)
set mask in rh labels to 1 (assumes input mask is an aseg)
set mask in lh labels to 1 (assumes input mask is an aseg)
dilate mask N times before applying
remove cerebellum from aseg mask (assumes input mask is an aseg)
use oval as output instead of 0
transfer only voxel value # from mask to out
transfer voxel-deletion edits (voxels=1) from mask to out vol
Do not allow MRImask() to apply a registration when inputs have different geom
